question: Zayed bin Sultan-al-Nahayan was a long serving President of which of the following?
explanation: Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan was the ruler of Abu Dhabi for more than 30 years from 6 May 1918 â€“ 2 November 2004 He was the founding father and the principal driving force behind the formation of the United Arab Emirates, becoming the Union\'s first President, a post which he held for a period of almost 33 years.
